title: Milky Way: Icy observatory reveals 'ghost particles'
description: An extraordinary image of ghost particles in the Milky Way is captured by an observatory buried at the South Pole.

title: 'Historic' 15-year plan to boost NHS workforce
description: There will be a big expansion in student places and apprenticeships - but critics say action is needed now.

title: Travis Scott will not face criminal charges over Astroworld crowd surge
description: Ten people died and thousands more were injured in the deadly crowd surge on 5 November 2021.

title: Disabled powerlifter unable to open own front door
description: Presenter Matthew Basset explores if enough has been done to help disabled people live their lives.

title: Flu hits breeding rate of UK's largest bird of prey
description: Conservationists suspect white-tailed sea eagles have been eating avian flu-infected prey.

title: Future of ice rinks at 'critical stage' due to soaring energy costs
description: Soaring energy costs lead to the pending closure of Ayr Ice Rink, with a warning that others are at risk.

title: The croquet grudge match that decides how River Nene is pronounced
description: Two counties vie for the right to call the River Nene "Nen" or "Neen" in an annual croquet bout.

title: The Ashes 2023: Was England's attack at Lord's 'absolute stupidity' or the way to go?
description: Ben Duckett hits back after pundits criticise England's batters against Australia - but was their approach right?

title: Scot Peterson not guilty over Parkland school shooting response
description: Scot Peterson is found not guilty of 11 charges including child neglect and culpable negligence.

title: British Masters: Justin Rose has one-shot lead over Jamie Donaldson after first round
description: England's Justin Rose has a one-shot lead over Jamie Donaldson after the opening round of the British Masters.

title: RAF diversity targets discriminated against white men
description: The inquiry began when a female officer quit, saying there was too much pressure to meet targets.

title: Affirmative action: US Supreme Court overturns race-based college admissions
description: The landmark decision strikes down decades-old policies defended as a way to boost diversity.

title: Inside Virgin Atlantic's rocket plane to space
description: The 90-minute mission had paying passengers - from the Italian Air Force - for the first time.

title: Ashes: England v Australia - second Test, day two highlights
description: England stage a superb fightback on the second day of the second Ashes Test against Australia at Lord's, but lose three wickets for 34 runs after tea.

title: Wagner still recruiting despite mutiny, BBC finds
description: The BBC called more than a dozen Russian recruitment centres and was told it's business as usual.

title: The Ashes 2023: England let Australia back in at Lord's
description: England come close to wasting a superb fightback with some brainless batting late on the second day of the second Ashes Test against Australia at Lord's.

title: Canadian wildfire smoke reaches UK, says Met Office
description: It is likely to produce some dramatic sunrises and sunsets but is not harmful, the Met Office says.

title: Yayoi Kusama's polka dot art opens Manchester's £211m arts venue Aviva Studios
description: Yayoi Kusama's huge inflatable sculptures open one of the UK's biggest new cultural venues for years.

title: Microscopic bag 'smaller than grain of salt' sells for $63k
description: A microscope - sold alongside the handbag - is needed to view its intricate design.

title: What Titan sub wreckage can tell us about the tragedy
description: How debris recovered from the sea bed near the Titanic could help investigators learn what happened.

title: The Ashes: Joe Root falls on 10 to diving Steve Smith catch
description: England's Joe Root is caught for 10 by Steve Smith as England lose another key wickets on day two of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: F1: Lewis Hamilton calls for car restrictions to end 'periods of dominance' by teams
description: Lewis Hamilton says Formula 1 should consider further restrictions on car development to stop teams building long periods of domination.

title: The Ashes 2023: Nathan Lyon injures right calf during second Ashes Test at Lord's
description: Australia spinner Nathan Lyon suffers a right calf injury during day two of the second Ashes Test against England.

title: Mason Mount: Manchester United agree deal to sign England midfielder from Chelsea
description: Manchester United agree a deal to sign England midfielder Mason Mount from Premier League rivals Chelsea.

title: Johnny Sexton: Ireland captain faces 13 July hearing over 'misconduct complaints'
description: Ireland captain Johnny Sexton faces a hearing over "misconduct complaints" arising from the Heineken Champions Cup final on 20 May.

title: Quiz of the week: Who missed the Rocketman's final mission?

title: Aspartame - is it a possible cause of cancer?
description: Reports suggest the World Health Organization could label the sweetener as possibly carcinogenic.

title: Madonna discharged from hospital after serious bacterial infection
description: The singer has returned home and is feeling better after intensive care stay, the BBC understands.

title: Court of Appeal decision raises difficult questions
description: The ruling puts the government under pressure to solve the issue of where to house asylum seekers.

title: France shooting: Who was Nahel M, shot by police in Nanterre?
description: He was learning to be an electrician and played rugby league but died at a police check near Paris.

title: Colleen Ballinger: YouTube star writes song to respond to accusing fans
description: Colleen Ballinger posts a video in which she defends herself in music while playing the ukulele.

title: Just Stop Oil: Three charged after activists disrupt Ashes Test at Lords

title: Benjamin Mendy said he slept with 10,000 women, court hears
description: The footballer is on trial accused of a rape and attempted rape at his Cheshire home.

title: The Ashes: England lose first wicket as Zak Crawley stumped on 48
description: Zak Crawley is stumped by Alex Carey on 48 as Australia pick up their first wicket on day two of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: At least a dozen dead as heat dome bakes southern US

title: Elizabeth line suspended due to swan on the track

title: Scotland's top law officer goes to court to change rape rule

title: Chrissy Teigen and John Legend welcome fourth child via surrogate

description: Australia's centurion Steve Smith is removed by Josh Tongue to leave Australia 393-8 on day two of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: Government heat pump scheme misses first year target
description: Heat pump costs, poor insulation and lack of workers hinder scheme but industry remains positive.

title: Sweden Quran burning sparks anger across Muslim world

title: Madonna: Famous friends send best wishes to hospitalised star

title: Undercover policing unit tactics not justified, says report

title: Andy Murray surprises Oxfordshire girl who uses tennis prosthetic

title: Joe Joyce: Heavyweight rematch with Zhilei Zhang set for 23 September
description: The rematch between British heavyweight Joe Joyce and China's Zhilei Zhang will take place at Wembley's OVO Arena on 23 September.

title: Suffolk lamb given wheels to stay mobile after legs fail

title: Decision not to prosecute soldier who killed boy quashed

title: Mason Mount: Chelsea and Man Utd set for talks over potential transfer
description: Chelsea and Manchester United are set to meet to discuss the potential transfer of Mason Mount this week, with the hope of resolving the current impasse.

title: Mortgages rates: Fresh round of rises imposed by lenders

title: Glastonbury festival crew member dies in tent on site
description: The death of a man in his 40s is not being treated as suspicious, police say.

title: Nadine Dorries and Jacob Rees-Mogg criticised over Partygate probe
description: The ex-ministers are accused of mounting "vociferous attacks" on a committee investigating Boris Johnson.

title: Thames Water has significant issues to address, Ofwat says

title: Tour de France 2023: Stage-by-stage guide

title: Bournemouth artist paints microscopic Van Gogh works inside watch

title: Staffordshire earthquake causes rumbling and homes to shake

title: The Ashes: England need to be sharper - Michael Vaughan previews day two

title: Watch: Rioters hurl fireworks at police in France
description: Violent protests entered a second night in Paris, after a teenager was shot by police during a traffic stop.

title: Arrests as riots rage in France over police killing

title: Passenger Amtrak train derails after hitting truck in California
description: The train was carrying nearly 200 passengers in California. The truck driver badly injured in the collision.

title: Councillors quitting over in-person meetings
description: Councils say not allowing meetings that include virtual attendance makes it harder for parents and disabled people.

title: Scot Peterson did not confront the Parkland school shooting. Should he be jailed?
description: A trial of a police officer for failing to protect Parkland students raises legal and moral questions.

title: The Nigerian with a mission to see a bagpipe revival
description: Inspired by seeing a bagpipe player in his youth, Chukwu Oba Kalu wanted more Nigerians to play.

title: Scientists pick up shock waves from colliding galaxies
description: Astronomers may have picked up the first signals from giant black holes spiralling in on each other.

title: Climate change: China's green power surge offers hope on warming
description: A boom in wind and solar energy in China may curb emissions faster than expected, a report says.

title: Kevin Doxey: 'Why did nobody stop our abusive teaching assistant?'

description: Millions of dollars are going into community violence prevention. Will it work?

title: Iran protests: Mother of Nika Shakarami tells of anguish
description: Nika Shakarami, 16, was allegedly beaten to death by security forces during protests.

title: The Papers: Thames Water on brink and Madonna in intensive care
description: Turmoil at the UK's biggest water company and the postponement of Madonna's world tour lead the papers.
